parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the exterior door handles can cause inconvenience and safety issues, as occupants may not be able to exit the vehicle quickly in emergency situations.
symptoms: making it difficult or impossible to open the doors.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Corrosion of Front and Rear Cradle Bolts and Retainers
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Corrosion of the front and rear cradle bolts and retainers can cause the engine to drop, leading to loss of steering and potential accidents.
symptoms: Cradle bolts pull through the retainer due to corrosion
causing the engine to drop and loss of steering.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Inadequate Recall and Repair of Corroded Cradle Bolts and Retainers
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The limited scope of the recall and the manufacturer's refusal to take responsibility for the damage caused by the corroded cradle bolts and retainers can lead to financial burdens on vehicle owners.
symptoms: Vehicle owners are not reimbursed for the damage caused by the corroded cradle bolts and retainers
and the manufacturer refuses to assist with repairs.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Unavailability of Parts for Recall Repair
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The lack of parts for recall repair can cause delays and inconvenience to vehicle owners, potentially leading to further safety issues.
symptoms: Recall work on the rear cradle bolts cannot be done due to a lack of parts.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Corroded brake calipers can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking power, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: brake pedal feels soft or spongy
brake pedal goes to the floor
grinding noise from the rear drums
rear brake shoes worn out or missing.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Intermittent brake pedal failure can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking power, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Brake pedal goes to the floor
brake pedal feels soft or spongy

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Rear brake system failure can cause the brake pedal to go to the floor, leading to a loss of braking power, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Grinding noise from the rear drums
rear brake shoes worn out or missing
brake pedal feels soft or spongy.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Suspension Failure Leading to Loss of Steering
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the suspension system can cause the vehicle to lose steering, leading to accidents or loss of control, which can result in injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: feeling of looseness or play in the steering wheel

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Tire Failure Due to Suspension Issues
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the suspension system can cause the tires to wear unevenly or prematurely, leading to tire blowouts, which can result in accidents or loss of control, especially at high speeds.
The failure of the suspension system can cause the vehicle to become unstable, leading to rollover accidents, which can result in injuries or fatalities.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Steering System Corrosion Due to Road Salt
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Corrosion of the steering system components, such as tie rods, can cause loss of steering control, leading to accidents or loss of vehicle control.
symptoms: steering wheel pulling to one side

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the steering column can cause the steering wheel to detach or become loose, leading to a loss of steering control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Steering wheel pulling away from the steering column
unusual noises or vibrations while steering.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An electrical fire in the steering column can cause damage to the vehicle's electrical system, leading to a loss of critical functions and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: Smoke or burning odor around the steering column area
